title: Three Financial Moves to Prepare for Retirement in Your 60s
subtitle: Essential steps for a smooth transition into retirement for those in their 50s.
content:
Three Financial Moves to Prepare for Retirement in Your 60s

If you're in your 50s, here are the only three financial moves you need to be ready for retirement in your 60s.

I’m Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Now I make financial content for free so you don’t have to pay for it.

1. Know When and Why You're Taking Social Security

The break-even point is usually around 78 to 80 years old. If you take it early at 62, you get less per month but more years. Wait until 70, and you’ll receive more each month but for fewer years. Decide what actually fits your life expectancy and projected cash flow needs.

2. Know Your Projected Annual Expenses

Multiply that number by 1.2 for taxes and margin of error, then multiply that result by 20, because a 5% withdrawal rate is usually what keeps your principal intact.

3. Simplify Your Portfolio

And I cannot stress this one enough: simplify your dang portfolio. Risk on equals stocks; risk off equals money markets. You don’t need 20 funds and 15 real estate deals because your primary residence already gives you plenty of real estate exposure.

Conclusion

If any of this is helpful, sign up for my free weekly newsletter by clicking the link in my bio. I’ll send you over another money playbook that actually works each week.
